column1: fullish and a little bit of seam away, Lynn slashes and chops into the surface
shortish and some width. That's all Lynn needs to slap it off the backfoot through the covers. Poor delivery. Feeding Lynn's strengths
takes the front leg out and slashes at a back of a length delivery. But not enough room and he chips it in the air. Doesn't middle it. On the bounce after it crosses extra cover
big swing as he looks for a heave over the leg side and gets a leading edge that flies through the empty cordon
slower fullish ball at 119ks, Lynn susses it out and presents a straight bat to gently push down the ground
short of a length, slow again at 118kmph, drops it between cover and extra cover for a single
ooh, lucky boundary. Very dicey. Pushes at a wide delivery outside off and gets a thick inside edge down to fine leg
short and wide, cuts and hits it into the ground towards cover
fuller ball outside off, drilled back off the inside of the bat
half-volley gift-wrapped with width. Lynn launches it straight over and the ball crashes into the sightscreen
short and wide, cuts slightly late and finds backward point
short ball, gets up too much, though, as Lynn comfortably gets under, and it's called a wide. A tight call
short of a length, swivels into a pull but doesn't middle it as the ball trickles away to midwicket
short and wide, and some more carnage. Crashes a slap through the gap at covers. Splits the field with precision
slower shortish ball, picks the lack of pace early and gets on top of the bounce before thwacking this over the mid-off region. Couple of bounces over the boundary
length ball on middle and leg, drops it towards mid-on, slightly wide of him, for a single
length ball outside off, pushed back off the inside of the bat

kicks up from a length and catches him off guard. And this another streaky boundary. One way or the other they continue finding runs. Off the inside edge down to fine leg as he tries to get on top of it
short and drifts away outside off, swing and a miss
floated up outside off, driven down to wide long-off
full outside off, driven to long-off
length ball, stays back as it straightens and then punches to long-off
short of a length, shifts back and turns it to midwicket
short and wide, backs away and slaps awkwardly through extra cover
fuller ball outside off, chases an extravagant drive and gets a big edge as the ball lobs in the air and lands around the square third man region
short and wide, much better connection this time as he slaps over backward point
short of a length, jumps back and drops into the off side
short and wide, drags a pull from outside off down the ground. Long-on dives to his left but the ball beats him
full toss, awkward height, manages to fend it away towards square leg
full outside off, clears the front leg and swings big to deposit him miles into the cow corner stands
short of a length, down the leg side, tries to glance and misses
shortish, turns around with a pull through backward square leg
backs away but the bowler follows him with a short of a length delivery. Tries to drop it in front and steal a single but Willey sprints towards the ball to prevent it
short ball does it. Lynn's gone. Vital breakthrough for the Scorchers. Lynn is rushed into a pull and gets a top-edge that lobs towards Klinger who dives forward from mid-on to snaffle it
back of a length, drops it to cover-point
short, down the leg side, thinks of glancing and makes a late call to stay outside the line
dropped. Deep backward point shells a sitter. Short and wide and McCullum slashes. The fielder runs to his right and gets right behind it but cannot hold on. Really got to take those
short and wide, opens up late for a fierce slap through backward of point
length ball, drifts down the leg side
short ball, left alone outside off
fullish length, tucked off the pads through square leg
good length on middle and leg, drops it in front of mid-on
short of good length outside off, defended
shortish, swivels around and pulls it out to deep backward square leg
advances down the ground to this fuller delivery and tries to force a shot but gets an inside edge to deep fine leg
stays back to this back of a length delivery and tucks it behind square
ripping turn outside off, drawing the batsman forward and beating him on the outside edge
advances down the ground and the bowler drags the length back. McCullum manages to swat it away to long-off with a flat bat
leg-sidish line, tucked off the pads to deep square leg
good length, outside leg, opens up and nudges towards square leg
comes down the track and manages to deal with the shortness as he pulls it away to backward square leg
back of a length, turns it away with the angle behind square
yorker around leg, clipped away to deep backward square
backs away to a short of a length delivery and swings awkwardly not holding any shape, gets beaten
shortish, pulls out to deep midwicket
backs away and this one's very wide and very full. Can't make contact as the ball misses off-stump very narrowly

this is a very poor shot. It's the worst delivery to be trying to slog. Has to fetch it from so far outside off, and what's worse, finds the man in the deep to perfection. Simple offering for deep midwicket
shortish and wide, cuts to the right of point who runs across and dives to stop the ball
shortish, pulls it away to deep square leg
length ball, some turn around middle and off, defended off the front foot
stays back to this length ball and pushes it back
full, defended down the pitch
full outside off, pushed down towards mid-off
tries to heave this length ball over the leg side and gets hit high on the pad. May have been some bat there too
makes some room to a short ball and guides it out to deep backward point

catching practice. McCullum falls to a soft dismissal. A nothing fuller delivery that he could have punched anywhere through the off side. Instead he chips a drive straight into the hands of extra cover
short of a length, gets on top of the bounce but finds the inside of the bat as he defends
shortish, slapped to backward point
slower full ball, squeezed out behind point on the off side
nearly splits the gap as he dabs this late outside off. Gully dives to his right and towards point to save it
length ball, punched to mid-off
short ball, down the leg side, beats the pull and hits him on the thigh pad
short ball, pulled out to deep midwicket
back of a length, outside off, moves towards it and punches down to long-on
short and outside off, loses shape as he goes for a forceful pull. The bounce gets big on him and he can't make contact
short of a length, pulled between long-on and deep midwicket
yorker outside off, jams the bat down and makes no contact
another yorker takes out the bail from leg stump. Jams the bat down again but gets an inside edge as the ball crashes into the stumps. Heat faltering after a strong start
sprayed down the leg side
yorker on off, dug out towards point
almost a yorker, ends up being a very low full toss that is pushed down to mid-off
short and wide, drags a pull wide of long-on
length ball, tucked to the gap at midwicket. Man in the deep and bowler sprint towards it but they come back for two
short and wide, cut through point

dropped. A sitter put down at square leg. Tye runs in from deep backward square leg and seems to have it all covered and he is probably just a fraction of an inch behind where he actually should have been. A slight misjudgement. Cutting got a top-edge as he tried to force a sweep
tucks this one to midwicket and sprints back for the second. The stumps are felled at the non-striker's end but he is comfortably inside
fuller delivery, pushed down to long-on
yorker on off, dug out off the inside of the bat through midwicket
a half-volley that curves into him. Gets the front leg out to give himself room and launches it over long-on. Big, clean strike

is that caught? Voges doesn't seem to be sure. Smartly taken nonetheless. They refer this upstairs. Soft signal is not out. Fuller delivery, driven uppishly in the direction of mid-off and it seems the ball may have just landed in front as he dived forward to take the catch. They try out multiple angles and they need conclusive evidence to overturn the on-field call. Not out it is
short ball, sitting up nicely, thumps a pull over square leg into the second tier
this one's a lot higher but not as clean. Didn't have as much room but he's managed to clear the boundary nevertheless. A full delivery that's been launched over long-on
full toss outside off, gets down and sweeps it to midwicket who lets the ball go through his legs. Clumsy
back of a length outside off, opens the face and steers to point
short ball, pulled through square leg
back of a length, slanted across, hangs back and stabs to point
short of a length, doesn't get hold of a pull to backward square leg
goes for a pull but this one's not short enough and he gets a bottom edge to the pad
shortish, gets on top of the bounce and runs it down to third man
in the air and over long-off. A low full toss that has been heaved over. Andrew Tye jumps up with one hand outstretched but the ball's gone well over him
crashes it straight down the ground and sweeps the non-striker off his feet as he scrambles for cover. Tye moves to his right from long-off to get behind it
yorker outside off, jams the bat down and makes no contact
very full around off, pushed down to long-on
full toss, slanted across and giving him lots of room, pummeled over deep midwicket
straight as an arrow. Oh my god! What sort of a shot is that! A low full toss that has been hammered straight over. That was fierce like a missile out of a firearm barrel
short of good length, pulled to deep midwicket
short of a length, turned behind square to fine leg

appeal for leg before and given. Seemed like that may have gone down leg but the umpire thought otherwise. A fuller delivery that curves into him and beats his attempted flick to pin him in front of leg
short of good length, shuffles across and turns it away between mid-on and midwicket
full toss outside off, presents a straight bat and pushes it out uppishly towards long-off
short ball, swivels around and pulls it through deep fine leg
walks across and tries to heave it over, gets an inside edge to the pad into the off side
full toss that angles down leg, helps it with the angle to launch it over long leg
length ball, tries to heave it over the leg side and gets an inside edge onto the pad as the ball shoots into the off side

yorker on middle and leg, Peirson dug it out straight down and the ball crashed into the stumps. Takes off for a run but with Burns not looking as he turned away to make his crease, he has to make his way back. Does so without fuss
walks across to meet this full toss and mows it through backward square leg
extremely full on leg stump, whips it away to the on side
short ball, makes room and slaps it straight over. Has that landed on the full? Nope, bounces just in front of the ropes
shortish and angled into him, backs away and slaps it over mid-off this time. Long-on runs to his left but the ball beats him
length ball, drifts towards leg stump and brushes the pad before going towards backward square leg
short ball, it's outta here. Just helps it with its angle to muscle a pull over backward square leg. Miles into the stands
goes for a yorker and ends up sending a low full toss instead that has been pummeled straight into the hands of long-on who moves a few quick steps to his right to take a fine catch
fuller delivery, drills it straight over the bowler's head and the man in the deep makes a diving save to pull it back inside the ropes and keep it down to a brace
full slider on leg stump, gets hit on the pad as he tries to clip it away
sliding length ball, tucked behind square
fullish length outside off, drilled down to long-on
full and flat outside off, driven down to long-off
sliding down the leg side, too much drift and called a wide
flat, short of a length and down the leg side
fullish outside off, driven back
length ball on off, defended back to end a sprint of a first over
slider, comes on with the arm on middle and leg, pats it away to the leg side
slight turns into him from outside off, stands tall and punches to cover
comes on with the arm quickly at 103ks on off-stump, punched back
flat and short, drags away a gentle pull between midwicket and mid-on
short and flat, pulled away to deep midwicket
short of a length, pulled behind square
fullish outside off, punched down to mid-off
short of a length outside off, drops it towards point with an open face
shortish, backs away and slaps it over the in-field on the off side. Through the extra cover region
length ball, leg-stumpish, defended back
stays inside the line and swings and misses outside off
short of good length outside off, shuffles across and gets on top of the bounce before dabbing it through the point region
length ball, drills it into the off side from a leg-stumpish line
short and wide, opens up for a late cut to backward point
comes down the track and meets the pitch before drilling this fuller ball down to long-off
short and wide, cut to sweeper cover. Through the gap
defended from the crease
gets forward and flicks this to the right of mid-on
tries to shovel this fuller ball over the leg side and gets a big leading edge as the ball shapes away late and is taken by third man easily. Breakthrough for Heat. They have stifled Scorchers so far

that's a beauty! A ripper Steketee. A back of a length delivery that straightens just enough to find the outside edge of Cartwright's bat as he stays in the crease and hangs his bat out. Taken by the first slip fielder. Steketee on a hat-trick
very full offering on middle and leg that's pushed straight down with a straight bat. Two fielders run back but they have enough time to come back for three
short and wide, cut to point
full and wide, heaves it over the in-field on the off side but off the toe end
short of a length on leg stump, backs away and drops it down the pitch

short of good length, tries to get on top of the bounce but gets an inside edge .Point comes running forward, bends and fires a throw while diving but misses the stumps. Had he hit, Turner was a goner
comes down slightly and punches this length ball to mid-off. It was a quick single and the fielder concedes an overthrow
short ball, changes his mind after thinking of a hook and offers no stroke
short ball, no shot offered as the ball goes well over the batsman's head. No-ball signalled
fuller delivery, carved straight over and into the hands of mid-off
just helps this one on its way as he turns around and swats it away off the hips to deep fine leg
short and spinning away outside off, pulled away to midwicket
googly that spins the other way outside off, wristily knocks it towards mid-on
short of a length, non-turner around off, defended down the ground
non-turning top spinner, punched to covers
advances down the ground and pushes it towards long-on
gets an inside edge to the pad as he fetches a sweep from outside off
full on middle, clipped away to deep midwicket
full slider around leg stumps, clipped away to square leg
floats up a fuller delivery outside off and it's been launched straight over. Sits nicely on the sightscreen where it lands
flat and short of a length, shuffles across and defends to the left of the bowler
flat and full on middle and leg, turned away behind square on the leg side
flat, shortish and wide, makes some room and punches to mid-off

full and outside off, floated across to him and he has holed out to long-on here. Tries to slog but had to fetch it from outside off. Scorchers sinking here, hurtling towards their first defeat of the tournament
full and sliding on leg, turned away to fine leg
floats up a fuller delivery around off and it's pushed down to long-on
pitched up on middle and leg, worked between midwicket and long-on
flat and spinning in from a back of a length, dabbed to square leg
scooped over the keeper's head, one bounce to the ropes. Gave away his intention nice and early, the length was on the shorter side, enough time to help that over.

this is a stunner at square leg. Swepson took a couple of steps and then flew to pluck that flick stroke which he failed to control. The brilliance of the fielder has made this possible. Scorchers slide further, it's all unraveling quickly

lifter on his ribs, but he somehow manages to squeeze that awkwardly to the fine leg boundary. Tried to ride the bounce, this got big on him despite his height, but still managed to turn this nicely past the keeper.
mistimes a big booming drive back to the bowler. Length not there for him to play the stroke
punched off the backfoot to mid-on for a quick single
slips a full toss down leg, looks to tickle it fine but misses. Wide called and rightly so
steers this length delivery down towards third man for an easy single
shapes to pull but this keeps low, just manages to scoop it over the bowler off the toe end
drifts away and then spins back in from length on off, he lunges forward and defends
toe-ends this sweep to deep midwicket. Looked to fetch it from way outside off
touch short, enough width as well, punched to long-off
plays outside the line of this straighter one, thick inside edge to midwicket
skiddy delivery on the stumps, shapes to pull, ends up flat-batting it to the bowler
shapes to upper cut that over the keeper's head, but misses.
belted back over the bowler's head, stunning stop at long-on. This was full and angling away, he stood inside the crease and used his strong bottom-hand to belt this over.
drives and beats the man at the edge of the ring at cover, the boundary rider comes around to cut that off

looks to belt this full toss back down the ground but gets a thick inside edge, long-off and long-on converge. There's a direct hit by the long-on fielder, but Agar was well in. Some artificial excitement as the third umpire is summoned, but Agar wasn't even flinching at the prospect of being out
run out chance missed. He mistimes a pull to midwicket, a direct hit at the bowler's end and Voges would've been walking straight back to the pavillion
gets on top of the bounce and helps this short delivery down to fine leg
he's walloped this full toss over the long-on boundary. Set himself up to swing that, helped that it was a full toss. Too much muscle

drifts away a full delivery, he's belted the drive to sweeper cover, who throws himself full length forward to stop but makes a mess of it by pushing it further away. Then he recovers and employs another dive to parry it to Doggett, coming across from long-on
slaps this shortish delivery to deep cover
hit hard, down to long-on
down on one knee as he swings this full delivery with the spin over long-on. Clean striking, right out of the top drawer.
nicely lobbed up, full toss though, down to long-off
drifts in a length ball on middle, defended back
too close for the cut, somehow manages to squirt this wide of cover

straight down the throat of deep midwicket. Flatter and fuller, but he had to fetch it from outside off, he was trying to hit towards the longer boundary as well, didn't hit it as well as he would've liked. Another one bites the dust.
backs away an slaps this length delivery down to long-off
steps out and drives inside out to deep cover
makes room and flays this full delivery inside out to deep extra cover
steered past the keeper. So, so clever. Too short, enough width as well. He stayed right back in the crease and simply lent direction to the delivery
back of length outside off, dabs this towards the man coming in from point
Dropped! mistimes this slog as he walks across to hit over deep midwicket, ends up toe-ending it towards the fielder running in from the ropes, turns out to be a tough, tough chance.
makes room to cut, but is beaten by the change in pace, bunted back towards the bowler off an inside edge
pulls this from outside off towards deep square
walks across the stumps and pulls this slower length ball straight to deep midwicket. Too easy a catch. The fielder didn't have to move much.
backs away and carves this wide of cover
makes room to squeeze this behind point but can't reach out to the delivery
off balance as he pulls this short delivery down to fine leg
fires this full and wide from around the stumps, batsman lets it go
swing and a miss. Played through early. It was banged in short, good bounce and zip for Cutting.
backs away to squeeze this towards third man, beaten again
pulls and misses
toe-ends a slog down to long-off
fuller on the pads, turned towards midwicket
feathers an upper cut, or has he? Backed away to go over point, this was banged in short deliberately. Replays suggest there was no bat
this was a swirler, but deep square settles underneath that mistimed pull shot to take it easy. The wheels are well and truly coming off the chase
backed away, the bowler followed him with the short ball but he still managed to make some room and ramp this over the keeper's head. Excellent improvisation
slices over cover, not much timing. Three men in chase, deep cover comes around to beat the other two
trying to be too clever, but is beaten for pace. Backed away to help this length ball past the keeper, but missed it as the off stump is pegged back.
whips this length delivery from outside off towards deep midwicket
steers this length ball wide of cover
gloves an attempted pull over the leaping wicketkeeper. Walked to the off side to help it along but this got big on him
bunted down towards long-off
steps out to pull but the bowler cleverly varies his pace as he bowls a slower bouncer, beaten as he was through with the pull early
defended right back
dropped at long-on . No timing or power on the slog, got it towards the toe-end. Valiant effort from Steekete as this was dying on him

looks to flick this leg side but the ball slants back in to beat his swing and trap him plumb in front of middle. By trying to premeditate, he was left hoping this was a full delivery but this skidded through off length, kept just a touch low to hit him right in front of the stumps
worked down to long-on
backs away and cuts, right into the gap between backward point and short third man
steered straight to short third man, a direct hit at the bowler's end would've had him

swung away, gets more elevation than distance. Deep midwicket and long-on converged. each looking at the other briefly, but safely taken by Gannon. at coming in from deep midwicket. All over, this has been as comprehensive as a win can get for Brisbane Heat. Five wickets for Doggett
